data.title: Local Entertainment Roundup: Aug. 8-15
meta_keywords: john f. kennedy center for the performing arts
data.meta_description: Roundup of arts and entertainment events happening in Fredericksburg and surrounding areas.
data.text:
Roundup of arts and entertainment events happening in Fredericksburg and surrounding areas.

8 thursday

Art After Hours: Fredericksburg Concert Band “Air and Space,” Gari Melchers Home and Studio at Belmont, 224 Washington St., Falmouth. Featuring classical repertoire of wind ensemble music, movie themes, Americana, jazz and pop. 6-8 p.m. Free admission; first come, first served. Tickets for beer/wine $7; food trucks accept cash or credit. Bring blankets, reusable cups and chairs; no outside alcohol permitted. Shuttle parking for overflow provided. garimelchers.org.

Live Wire: The Ultimate AC/DC Experience, The Groove Music Hall, 6501 Dominion Raceway Ave. $27 and up. 8 p.m. show, 7 p.m. doors. thegroovemusichall.com.

Comedy Night, Full Distance Brewing, 650 Corporate Drive, Stafford. 7-8:30 p.m. fulldistancebrewing.com.

9 friday

Film: “Dick Tracy,” Library of Congress Packard Theater, 19053 Mt. Pony Road, Culpeper. Buena Vista Pictures, 1990. 7:30 p.m. Free. 540/827-1079, ext. 79994; loc.gov/programs/audio-visual-conservation.

Stage Door Productions: “Laughter on the 23rd Floor,” Allstate Community Theater, 810 Caroline St. 8 p.m. Through Aug. 11. $18-$25. stagedoorproductions.org.

“Run for Your Wife,” Westmoreland Players Theatre, 16217 Richmond Road, Callao. 7:30 p.m. Through Aug. 18. 804/529-9345; westmorelandplayers.org.

10 saturday

Film: “Wonder Woman,” Library of Congress Packard Theater. Warner Bros., 2017. 2 p.m. See Aug. 9 listing.

Film: “The Crow,” Library of Congress Packard Theater. Miramax, 1994. 7:30 p.m. See Aug. 9 listing.

Performing Arts at Fawn Lake: Piano Quartet with Michelle, Brett, Wendy and Blair, FLCA Clubhouse, 11300 Longstreet Drive, Spotsylvania. Featuring Michelle Kim (violin), assistant concertmaster of the New York Philharmonic; soloist Brett Deubner (viola); Grammy winner Wendy Sutter (cello); and international soloist and recording artist, Blair McMillen (piano). 7-8:30 p.m. $75–$85. performingartsatfawnlake.org/events/

Atlantic Union Bank After Hours: Alabama, Meadow Event Park, 39 Meadow Farm Road, Doswell. With Drew Green. 7 p.m., doors at 5:30 p.m. afterhoursconcertseries.com.

Stage Door Productions: “Laughter on the 23rd Floor,” Allstate Community Theater. 8 p.m. See Aug. 9 listing.

“Run for Your Wife,” Westmoreland Players Theatre. 7:30 p.m. See Aug. 9 listing.

History at Sunset: The Legacy of Ellwood: Slavery, Resistance, and Power, Ellwood on the Wilderness Battlefield, 36380 Constitution Highway, Orange. Join NPS rangers for a stationary talk about this complex place with a storied past of slavery and resistance; a place where competing ideas of duty, loyalty, and freedom shaped the daily lives of the people who called this place home. 6:30-8 p.m. Bring a chair. 540/693-3200.

Iris sale, Meadows Farms Nursery, 5043 Plank Road. All types of bearded and beardless irises. 8 a.m. to 1 p.m. (or sold out). Sponsored by Fredericksburg Area Iris Society. 540/582-5799 or 540/847-1236; fburg.area.iris.society@gmail.com; irisregion4.com/FAIS2024_Sale.htm.

11 sunday

Acoustic Sunday, Ingleside Vineyards, 5872 Leedstown Road, Oak Grove. Featuring music by Moonshine Society Duo (blues) and food by Amiee’s Sandwiches. 1-5 p.m. In case of inclement weather, our indoor pavilion may be used. inglesidevineyards.com.

Stage Door Productions: “Laughter on the 23rd Floor,” Allstate Community Theater. 3 p.m. See Aug. 9 listing.

“Run for Your Wife,” Westmoreland Players Theatre. 3 p.m. See Aug. 9 listing.

12 monday

Music on the Steps: Limón & Latin Feeling Band, Central Rappahannock Regional Library, 1201 Caroline St. 6:30-7:30 p.m. Free. Bring chair or blanket. In the event of inclement weather, concert will be moved to the library theater. librarypoint.org.

14 wednesday

“Murder on the Orient Express,” Riverside Center for the Performing Arts, 95 Riverside Parkway. Through Sept. 8. $55–$82 plus processing fee. 540/370-4300; riversidedt.com.

15 thursday

Downtown Movies in the Park: “Monsters Inc.,” Riverfront Park. 7 p.m., with themed activities at 6:30 p.m. Bring blankets or lawn chairs. FredericksburgMainStreet.org.

3rd Thursday Summer Concert Series: Blake Esse, 111 Commerce St., Culpeper. 5–9 p.m. culpeperdowntown.com.

“Murder on the Orient Express,” Riverside Center for the Performing Arts. Dinner served at 5:30 p.m. See Aug. 14 listing.

Local roundup

Days and hours of operation may vary.

art

810 Weekend Gallery: New works by Beverley Coates (watercolors), Robyn Ryan (acrylics) and Lynn Abbott (acrylics and oils). 540/371-4099.

ARTFactory: “Earthly Delights,” works by Sandra McClelland-Lewin and Bettie Sperty, Aug. 1-Sept. 14; artist reception Aug. 10, 6-8 p.m. virginiaartfactory.org.

Art First Gallery: “A Walk in the Garden,” a collection of new painting by Leah Fromer. Through Sept. 1. Acrylic, assemblage, collage, drawing, oil, photography, printmaking, textiles, three-dimensional objects such as jewelry, sculpture and watercolor. artfirstgallery.com.

Artful Dimensions Gallery: “A Capitol Vase,” works by Joseph Wilkinson. Through Sept. 1. artfuldimensionsgallery.com.

Artists’ Alliance at Jarrett Thor Fine Arts: “Sweet Summer Stuff,” oil paintings by Nancy Brittle. Aug. 9-Sept. 8. “Flowers” themed all-member exhibit. Second Friday Art Walk, 6-9 p.m. artgallerycolonialbeach.com.

Beach Paws Boutique: Works by local artists. Second Friday Art Walk, 6-9 p.m.

Brush Strokes Gallery: “Beautiful Blooms,” works by Carol Waite. Handcrafted jewelry, unique glass art, charcoal drawings, pastels, photography, paintings in oils, watercolors, acrylics, metal sculpture and mixed-media. brushstrokesfredericksburg.com.

Canal Quarter Arts: Works by local artists.

CoBe Workspaces: Works by Janice Jones, the director of the Arts Center of Montross. Second Friday Art Walk, 6-9 p.m.

Coldwell Banker Elite: 223 N. Irving Ave. Works by Colonial Beach Artists’ Guild. Second Friday Art Walk, 6-9 p.m. with music.

Colonial Beach Artists Guild: Potomac River Regional Art Show, 11 a.m.-4 p.m. Saturday through Sunday inside Town Center. Second Friday Art Walk, 6-9 p.m.

Colonial Beach Chamber of Commerce: Glass on glass and mosaic pieces by Joyce Reid. Second Friday Art Walk, 6-8:30 p.m.

Colonial Beach Brewing: Works by local artists. Second Friday Art Walk, 6-9 p.m.

Colonial Beach Museum: Open for Second Friday Art Walk, 6-9 p.m.

Darbytown Art Studio: Works by local artists. facebook.com/DarbytownArt.

Dockside Realty: Paintings in oils and acrylics by Nancy Owens. Second Friday Art Walk, 6-8:30 p.m.

Fredericksburg Area Museum: “Lafayette’s World: Revolutionary Ideals and the Limits of Freedom,” curated by Dr. Gaila Sims, curator of African American History and Special Projects. Also on display: “Out and About: The Walk in Closet.” Call for artists: Black Arts Festival, Nov. 1 at Hurkamp Park and Nov. 2 at Riverfront Park. Interested artists should email images of their work to sernst@famva.org. famva.org.

Fredericksburg Center for the Creative Arts: Frederick Gallery: Artist Choice Regional All-Media Juried Exhibition. Members Gallery: Catherine Hillis. fccagallery.org.

Hawthorn Mercantile: Works by local artists and Finklepotts Fairy Hair. Second Friday Art Walk, 6-9 p.m.

Jamestown Settlement: “Ruth E. Carter: Afrofuturism in Costume Design” exhibit, through Dec. 1. 757/253-4838; jyfmuseums.org.

Jarrett Thor Gallery: A collection of works by local artist Nancy Wing, featuring land- and waterscapes from the region and other studies of flowers and animals. “Flowers” themed all-member exhibit. Second Friday Art Walk, 6-9 p.m. 804/224-7200.

LibertyTown Arts Workshop: “In Her Nature,” works by Dolly Whitley. Through August. Classes available. libertytownarts.com.

Library of Virginia: “Indigenous Perspectives,” a multimedia exhibition that explores voices and experiences of Virginia’s tribal communities, as well as related items from the Library’s collections. Through Aug. 17. lva.virginia.gov.

Listen now and subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Google Podcasts | Spotify | RSS Feed | SoundStack

Louisa Arts Center: “EMPHASIS,” works by Darius Quarles, June 14-Aug. 2 in Purcell Gallery. louisaarts.org.

Mary Washington Hospital: New works by local artists on display in the Main Floor hallway gallery. Works by featured artist Barbara Taylor Hall will hang through the end of October. A percentage of each sale is donated to cancer care. Art may be purchased through the Gift Shop.

Mason Exhibitions Arlington: “A Closer Look: Conflicted Art from Ukraine,” through Aug. 23. masonexhibitions.org; conflictedart.com.

Meyer Fine Art (new gallery): “This Drop of Earth: American Landscape Miniatures, Redwood Library and Athenaeum, Newport, RI,” June 20-Oct. 20. meyerfineart.gallery.

National Building Museum: “Building Stories,” an immersive exploration into the world of architecture, engineering, construction and design through hands-on activities, media installations, sketching and reading; “Frank Lloyd Wright’s Southwestern Pennsylvania,” through March 17, 2025. nbm.org.

National Museum of the Marine Corps: “Full Metal Jacket,” featuring images taken on set by actor Matthew Modine, through September 2025; “Go to War … Do Art,” 80 years of the Marine Corps Combat Art Program features 80 works on paper by 29 combat artists, through Aug. 9. usmcmuseum.com.

Ponshop Studio and Gallery: Fine art, ceramics and handmade jewelry and accessories. ponshopstudio.com.

Port Royal Museum of American History: New additions to White House China collection. Open every Saturday from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Free; donations appreciated. 804/370-5285.

Riverboat on the Potomac: Works by local artists. Open for Second Friday Art Walk.

Riverview Inn: Works by local artists. Second Friday Art Walk, 6-9 p.m.

RMS Designs: Works by Phil McKinney, a visual and performing artist. Second Friday Art Walk, 6-9 p.m.

Sophia Street Studios: “A Moment in Time,” featuring a collection of plein air paintings from around the country by Catherine Hillis.

Tappahannock Artists’ Guild: “Beyond the Sail” with works by KonKons and Ellen Werner. tapparts.org.

Virginia Museum of Fine Arts: “Theaster Gates: Wonder Working Power,” through Jan. 1. vmfa.museum.

Virginia Museum of History and Culture: “Julia Child: A Recipe for Life,” through Sept. 2. Event: First Fridays at VMHC, 5-8 p.m., includes food trucks, family-centered activities, live music and happy hour specials in the Museum Café. virginiahistory.org.

Willey’s BBQ: Outdoor art. Weather dependent. Second Friday Art Walk, 6-9 p.m.

music

ARTfactory: SummerSounds Concert Series: Lil Maceo, Aug. 17, 6:30-8 p.m. at Harris Pavilion. Free. virginiaartfactory.org.

The Birchmere: White Ford Bronco, Aug. 9. birchmere.com.

Central Rappahannock Regional Library: Music on the Steps, every Monday from June 3 through Aug. 26 from 6:30-7:30 p.m. Aug. 12: Limón & Latin Feeling Band. Free. Bring chair or blanket. In the event of inclement weather, concert will be moved to the library theater. librarypoint.org/music-steps.

Market Square: Sounds of Summer, 6:30–8:30 p.m. Friday nights June 7-Sept. 6. Aug. 16: Brisk (alternative, ‘90s). Free. famva.org.

Meadow Event Park: Atlantic Union Bank After Hours: Alabama, Aug. 10. 7 p.m., doors at 5:30 p.m. afterhoursconcertseries.com.

National Museum of the Marine Corps: “The President’s Own” U.S. Marine Band, Aug. 22 and Aug. 29, 7-8 p.m. Free. usmcmuseum.com.

Performing Arts at Fawn Lake: Piano Quartet with Michelle, Brett, Wendy and Blair, Aug. 10 from 7-8:30 p.m. at FLCA Clubhouse. Featuring Michelle Kim (violin), assistant concertmaster of the New York Philharmonic; soloist Brett Deubner (viola); Grammy winner Wendy Sutter (cello); and international soloist and recording artist, Blair McMillen (piano). $75–$85. performingartsatfawnlake.org/events/

Richmond Music Week: Aug. 2-11 at numerous live music venues. richmondmusicweek.com.

Wolf Trap Foundation for the Performing Arts: Lyle Lovett and his Large Band, with Preservation Hall Jazz Band, Aug. 9; KIDZ BOP LIVE 2024, Aug. 10; The Concert: A Tribute to ABBA, Aug. 11; The Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra with Wynton Marsalis, with Cécile McLorin Salvant, Aug. 15. wolftrap.org.

theater

Fredericksburg Theatre Ensemble: “The Shawshank Redemption,” Aug. 23-Sept. 1 at Allstate Community Theater. fredericksburgtheatre.org.

The Kennedy Center: Opera House: “Back to the Future: The Musical,” July 23-Aug. 11. Broadway Center Stage: “Nine,” through Aug. 11. Theater Lab: The Ultimate Improv Show, July 30-Aug. 11. kennedy-center.org.

National Theatre: “MJ the Musical,” Aug. 13-Sept. 8. thenationaldc.com.

Riverside Center for the Performing Arts: Agatha Christie’s “Murder on the Orient Express,” Aug. 14-Sept. 8. $70–$82 dinner and show; $55–$65 show only. 540/370-4300; riversidedt.com.

Shakespeare Theatre Company: “Comedy of Errors,” Sept. 10-Oct. 6 in Klein Theatre. shakespearetheatre.org.

Signature Theatre: “Soft Power,” Aug. 6–Sept. 15. sigtheatre.org.

Stage Door Productions: “Laughter on the 23rd Floor,” Fridays-Sundays through Aug. 11. $18-$25. stagedoorproductions.org.

Virginia Rep: November Theatre: “Misery,” Aug. 31-Sept. 29. va-rep.org.

family

Children’s Museum of Richmond: “Bug Squad,” a hands-on exhibit exploring the unique abilities of bugs, May 14-Aug. 25. cmorva.org.

Gari Melchers Home & Studio: Preschool Palette classes nurtures child’s inner artist through engaging books, garden walks and colorful process-based sensory and art explorations. Themes change monthly. Open daily with family-friendly, interactive tours, scavenger hunts and sketching bags. 540/654-1015; garimelchers.org.

National Museum of the Marine Corps: Family Day: Land, Sea, Air. Complete STEAM-focused activities that highlight the unique challenges of all three operating environments all while exploring the Museum. Aug. 10, 11 a.m.-2 p.m. National Aviation Day, Aug. 19, 10 a.m.-2 p.m. Free. usmcmuseum.com.

Science Museum of Virginia: “Discover Steampunk,” interactive exhibit featuring stories of 19th-century visionaries who dreamed of what life would be like today, through Aug. 18; “Body Worlds: The Anatomy of Happiness,” through Sept. 2. smv.org.

etc.

Ashland Fourth Fridays: Artists, musicians, and performers take over Downtown Ashland every fourth Friday from 5-8 p.m., May through September. AshlandFourthFridays.com.

Bingo, American Legion Post 320, 8456 Brock Road, Spotsylvania. Games start at 6:30 p.m. Thursdays; doors open at 5 p.m. Food available for purchase. Proceeds benefit veterans, their families and the community. 540/548-8069.

Bingo, St. Michael High School, 6301 Campus Drive, Spotsylvania. Games start at 6:30 p.m. Thursdays and Saturdays. Doors open 1.5 hours prior. 540/907-9736; facebook.com/saintmichaelbingo.

Busch Gardens: Summer of Wonder, with local art installations and murals, indoor shows, specially curated menu offerings, live concerts every Saturday, and fireworks displays. June 14-Aug. 11. buschgardenswilliamsburg.com.

Curitiba Art Café: Latin Dance Night with Elle Jay, every third Friday of the month from 6–9 p.m. Free Latin dance lesson followed by open dancing.

Ferry Farm: Archaeological Summer Dig, Monday-Friday from 10 a.m.-4 p.m. weather permitting. Self-guided grounds-only tours for adults are $9, $4 for ages 6 and up, under 6 are free. 540/370-0732; kenmore.org.

Fredericksburg Hauntings Tours: 90-minute walking ghosts tour, every Friday and Saturday through Aug. 24. $15. Tours are limited; reservations required. For more information, call 540/760-5450.

The Fredericksburg Lafayette Bicentennial Commemoration: Lecture Series focuses on aspects of Lafayette’s life, his world, and his influence on the American Revolution and the early Republic. March–November. fxbg.com/lafayette.

Gari Melchers Home and Studio: Plein Air Days, 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. every third Sunday and following Thursday; free admission; registration suggested. Cars and Coffee, 8-10 a.m. in the museum parking lot the second Saturday of each month May-October; free. Woodland Hike, conducted by Virginia Master Naturalists, Aug. 25 at 2 p.m.; free. GariMelchers.org.

Hanover Tavern: Up The Back Staircase: Behind the Scenes Tour, Aug. 8, 6:30 p.m. and 7:45 p.m. $20; advance purchase required. Haunted Tavern Tour, Aug. 15 at 8 p.m. $12; advance purchase required. Steins & Wines, Aug. 17, 11 a.m.-5 p.m.; $25-$30. Bridgerton: A Fete, Sept. 8, 3-7 p.m. Regency-era dress encouraged. $100; advance purchase required. hanovertavern.org.

Jamestown Settlement: History & Cosplay: A Match Made in Imagination, Aug. 10, 6:30 p.m. Presentation by Shasta Schatz, a reception with light hors d’oeuvres and cash bar and a tour of the “Ruth E. Carter: Afrofuturism in Costume Design” exhibit. Costumes encouraged. jyfmuseums.org.

Kings Dominion: Food & Wine Festival, select dates Aug. 2-25 (Friday-Sunday). kingsdominion.com.

Payne’s Farm: Guided tours, led by Friends of Wilderness Battlefield interpreters. Weekends from June 8-Aug. 11, 9 a.m.–5 p.m. Good walking or hiking shoes recommended. Free; donations welcome. fowb.org.

Pickers Supply: Salsa Dance, 6–7 p.m. Sunday. $20 per class, or $120 for all seven. No partner required. 540/847-4581; olddominionhis@yahoo.com. Swing Dance, beginner lesson at 7:30 p.m. Saturdays; dancing 8–11 p.m. No partner or previous dance experience required. $10 per person. 540/847-4581; DanceFXBG.com.

Railroad Museum and Rail Excursion: Museum is open 9 a.m. to noon Saturdays. Visitors planning on riding the train should arrive by 10:30 a.m. Train rides conducted weather permitting. Free; donations accepted to support operations. 11700 Main St., Fredericksburg. 301/653-7983; rrmuseum.org.

Rice’s Hotel / Hughlett’s Tavern: Classic and Antique Car Show, Aug 17. from 9 a.m-1 p.m. Local owners of classic and antique cars are invited to participate. No charge. 804/580-3377; RHHTFoundationinc.org.

Rising Sun Tavern: Pirates and Punch, Aug. 17 hourly from 5-7 p.m. Learn about history of piracy in early Virginia, sample historically based refreshments and snacks and enjoy sea songs by the Rappahannock Whalers. For ages 21 and up. washingtonheritagemuseums.org.
